message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper addresses the problem of goal-based imitation learning for robots, which involves combining task and motion planning to disambiguate the true intention of the demonstrator in a video demonstration. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a motion reasoning framework that uses machine learning techniques to recognize the goals of the demonstrator, which suggests that it may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also uses computer vision techniques to analyze the video demonstrations, which suggests that it may belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the problem of reproducing the same task in a different environment, which suggests that it may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
